comments.commentBody:
Let the Bush tax cuts expire.
Keep progressive marginal rates.
Eliminate all deductions except mortgage and charity.

So let me get this straight, Republican's don't want big government or many government employees, however they want our tax dollars to fund the military? So in turn we provide the means for the mega wealthy to secure resources in foreign lands by "diplomatic means" and some how as they reap the benefits of certain government policies eventually those gains will trickle down to us?
Anyone with any sense knew from the outset that the super committee will not agree.  Plan now for the across the board cuts.

Let's not hear any talk about increasing the eligibility age for Medicare since we really should have a single payer plan anyway. I'm 75 but would have been fine without social security at age 65 but if there were no Medicare for those 65 and 66, they would have to get private insurance with higher prices and worse coverage. Medicare savings can be made by eliminating overused procedures and medications such as unproven chemotherapy but not by changing eligibility.

As long as Republicans continue to parrot (who is the hand up their puppet backs?) no tax cuts, they are digging themselves in deeper.  But maybe that is what it will take, a collapse of the modern Republican Party as Reagan began it:  tax cuts for the rich, tax increases for everybody else, firing of a union entirely (air traffic controllers), slashing aide to mentally ill (still dealing with homeless because of that), and on and on.  He was nuts and I wish somebody would stand up and say to run as a Republican for President you have to lose your soul: Robert Dole, John McCain and now Romney.  All good Americans until they were deep in the Evil Empire.  Stranger than fiction.  Wonder how this is going to end?  The masses wake up from their zombie state?  I'd say it's happening already for a lot of Americans, hopefully a good chunk of voters will, as we say at my elementary school, have their brains turned up to 10, a year from now.  Not make a good corporate board?  Heck, they wouldn't even do well as second graders at my school.

The Democrats propose, the Republicans reject. Aside from being a microcosm of the Congress, the "Supercommittee" is a waste of taxpayers money and insulting to anyone with the ability to reason and think.

Again and again. How people, repeating the mantra about 30-40-50% of all taxes paid by rich, don't understand one simple thing - corporations are super rich because they put huge mark up on the products you are consuming.

Just think: there is given amount of money in the system in given period of time. Corporations provide goods and services, financial institutions are playing with your money. We are selling our skills and labour and consuming.

In order to increase profits corporations put maximum possible for consumers mark ups on their products and not increasing salaries proportionaly - that's what they did for the last 30 years. Financial institutions are pumping money out of your pockets to speculate, making money on bets in both directions: up and down, slightly sharing with you on ups, and emptying your pockets on down - at the end you recieve at the most 10-15% in the best years, and losing in crisises. All they leave to you in average is 2-4% a year, making for themselves hundreds, sometimes thousands percent of interest. They call it financial services. ))))

When the money is pumped out of your pocket, and you cannot consume any more the government intervenes and prints money, because those who robbed you don't want to share, but you have to survive. So, the taxes and new money come to support you. And the cycle begins again. And again corporations and banks are pumping out money accumulating the results of YOUR skills and labour, not their's.

So, super rich first rob you, saying that the need to grow and only after the robbing they pay taxes, and receive additional tax breaks on this robbery. And they need your support and understanding, and they wash your brains till they are empty and clean, and then you repeat after them, that they pay the major part of taxes, that they are job creators, etc. And you finally forget that the brightest ideas like iPad CANNOT be implemented without you, that without you they are NOTHING. vote for YOURSELF!

"In April, Mr. Obama proposed savings of at least $200 billion in Medicare and at least $100 billion in Medicaid."

This is a solution? Hitting the most needy and those on fixed income? How about scaling back the wars, not starting new ones, and letting the Libyans, Egyptians and others pay for their own problems. Obama has thrown around $2 billion here and there like it's candy, saying that it was only a small amount each time.

It's time to spend US tax revenues on Americans and let the rest of the world fend for itself.
What's the point?  The Republicans will say, that's not enough and the Democrats will continue to give away the store.

Consider that the people who negotiated this deal expected the gang of 12 to fail.

Then they agreed to mandatory cuts in defense and entitlements, followed by the possible expiration of the Bush tax cuts (extension of which was not part of the agreement), which effectively raise taxes.

What remains to be seen is whether the republi-can'ts can leverage the threat of tax increases to the middle class into continuing the tax cuts for the rich. Hopefully, Obama will just say no this time, and allow the Bush tax cuts to expire, as he promised. This will be easy to do as all they have to do is not come to agreement.

If congress does absolutely nothing, that is what will happen.

I would prefer not to pay higher taxes, but will do so gladly if that is the eventual outcome. Expiration of the Bush tax cuts with reduction in defense will go a long way to balancing the budget.

The republi-can'ts will go into the next election having done nothing, arguably not voting for tax increases, but having accomplished them.

After this all happens, deficit projections will be greatly reduced, and focus can return to important things like unemployment and climate change. Unfortunately, the current republi-can't majority in the house prevents any action on these two critical areas.

I am optimistic.

The Senate won't even discuss the 2011/12 budget with the House, and didn't pass a budget for 2010/11 when the Democrats controlled the entire process.

This process is nothing but a clear demostration of the limitations of a representative democracy. Unrestrained government debt and using government powers to fercibly transfer wealth between groups will be listed as the cause of death on the grave of the American Dream.

overtaxed - "I like Buffett's plan of denying re-election to congress if it fails to reasonably balance the budget -- public service should be an opportunity, not a job."  The problem is, define "reasonable."
It wouldn't matter if Grover Norquist himself came up with Obama's latest plan...the Repubs will not vote for anything that Obama is for...the Super Committee is Super Doomed.

The Republicans refuse to pay what we owe....they prefer to borrow from the Chinese.

There approach is simply not conservative. Conservative is paying your bills. If you don't like the bills, fine, work to cut back in the future. but not paying what we owe today, for two wars and a big tax cut, is simply not conservative.
You are going to get nothing -- NOTHING -- from the Republicans.  Count on it.  And shame on them.

Let's see, the 27 different nations connected with the Euro CAN agree to take SOME action, but the almighty stand-alone USA can only dither and play politics while ITS goes up in smoke and big bankers laugh all the way to their off-shored accounts?

Republicans are insisting on a seismic shift --on concessions tantamount to weakening if not repealing the foundation of the New Deal: Reductions in Social Security, Medicare, and Medicaid (though of these, only Medicaid contributes to the deficit today).

Now, the Democrats are actually acquiescing to these *gigantic* changes for a mere 1 trillion in new taxes. Yes, a "mere" one trillion, because in the grand scheme of things, over ten years, such an amount amounts to a small percentage of chump change.

Democrats, if they were true to their roots and supporters, would only be willing to adjust Social Security and Medicare if Republicans in exchange were to significantly move on major issues such as limiting the capacity of corporations to send jobs overseas, or in breaking up monopolies that hinder employment and innovation, or in terminating the "too big to fail" chokethat keeps loans out of main street.

But no, instead of demanding actual deep changes that can save the Middle Class, Democrats demand only changes in window dressing...

When the decline of the American Middle Class is chronicled, it will not be the Republicans the ones with the majority of blame. No, it will be the timorous Democrats --they were the ones that are selling the American Middle Class for peanuts.
There is still no reason to be optimistic.  This is like a family about to get evicted from a $750,000 house.  It's dishonorable.  Both parties are evil.

The super committee will fail to reach an agreement, but the automatic cuts will NOT happen.  Lawsuits and charges of unconstitutionality will rage, and the "automatic cuts" question will go to the courts. Ultimately, the "automatic cuts" will be thrown out by a 5-4 decision of the Supreme Court.  Progress of any sort will not be made.
#3Will - wonder if you'll change your tune when you have to stand in the unemployment line!

"According to the National Employment Law Project ... Seven in 10 of the unemployed said that the government should pay benefits for 99 weeks or more."   Ohhh, okay, I get it:  70% of currently-unemployed persons as polled by the left-leaning "National Employment Law Project" (check its website) said that unemployment benefits should be provided for 2 years or more.   Huh.   And 99% percent of potheads said that unemployment benefits should be provided for 9 years or more.   SO WHAT.

Remember the old song: "How're ya gonna keep 'em down on the farm, after they've seen Paree?"

Even with all of their autocratic control and police state apparatus, it will be very tough for the Chinese to put this genie back in the bottle.

comments.commentTitle: No more 3D please! Decent swashbuckling but no cake.
comments.commentBody:
Attempting to critique this movie in the light of real filmmaking would only show the incompetence of the critic. This movie is a product designed for a night of family fun. Nonetheless Mila Jovovich and Christoph Waltz are capable of better. Usually if I don't see this delivered from good actors I hang the medal around the Director's neck. The performances on the whole just serve to make the script move. I would have preferred to not hear any of the characters speak but have Mathew Macfayden's rich vocal arsenal narrate the whole thing. Yet it was refreshing to behold a female swashbuckling character a la Jovovich in full 1700s French noble regalia execute aerial acrobatics through not one but two old standby booby trapped tunnels of peril to snatch that good old treasure and later fight off 15 swordsmen with more magical levitation and floatation. I always like to see one movie try something like wired fight choreography and then 150 other movies do the same exact thing. One more thing I can check off the list when choosing my entertainment. Special Thanks Hollywood for learning something from Chinese filmmaking and milking it to death. The swashbuckling factor however was pretty good in my opinion, as far as 3 Musketeers movies go.

And to their credit the filmmakers were courageous in choosing the new Alexa digital camera by Arri instead of film or the Red camera. But for 3D the picture was not sharp and bright enough as with many films selling 3D. That is more due to 3D currently being an embarrassingly terribly implemented technology. If you like paying extra for a picture that is not as bright and is less sharp than the regular non-3D version then pay for the 3D and go in with the hope of seeing a few shots that depict some poor excuse of an illusion of depth. 3D is an empty promise and waste of money on 99% of movies.

Good for Microsoft, congratulations!

Now they need to go full-out supporting creation of apps, and planning for the versions of windows that will come out over the next 10 years. Play like this will be a huge winner and competition is intense. Remove bureaucracy from the unit that makes this OS and run it lean with big incentives for success. Only then will you have a chance of succeeding.
Glad to hear that my under-decorated bachelor pad is becoming en vogue.
